required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bikes For Life: Measuring the Effects of a Bicycle Distribution Program on Pediatric Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Bikes For Life: Measuring the Effects of a Bicycle Distribution Program on Pediatric Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators propose a study to evaluate the success of a bicycle distribution program in increasing physical activity level, decreasing sedentary activity levels and positively affecting body-mass index (BMI) in participants aged 6 to 12 years old with overweight or obesity, who do not already own a bicycle, and are patients at the Children's Hospital Colorado Child Health Clinic (CHC), Lifestyle Medicine Clinic, or Rocky Mountain Youth Clinics. The investigators anticipate that the receipt of a bicycle will increase physical activity level, decrease sedentary activity time and decrease or stabilize patients' BMI. The investigators will answer this research question by distributing bicycles to 525 children and conducting follow up visits over the course of a year to measure the outcomes of interest.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a stepped-wedge, randomized controlled trial. Possible subjects will be randomized to 1 of 4 groups. Each patient will serve as his or her own control. Within each stratum of four, patients will be randomly assigned to intervention initiation times (~130 per initiation time). Intervention initiation times will occur every other month up to a maximum of six months.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline BMI through study completion up to 78 weeks
Change from Baseline Physical Activity through study completion up to 78 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average time spent participating in physical activity

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Sedentary Activity through study completion up to 78 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Average time spent in sedentary activities

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Consumption of sugary drinks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Consumption of Sugary Drinks through study completion up to 78 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Consumption of Fast Food
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Consumption of Fast Food through study completion up to 78 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of times fast food was consumed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Consumption of Fruits through study completion up to 78 weeks
Change from Baseline Consumption of Vegetables through study completion up to 78 weeks

arm_group.description: Receive the bicycle intervention at 0 months after enrollment.
Receive the bicycle intervention at 2 months after enrollment.
Receive the bicycle intervention at 4 months after enrollment.
Receive the bicycle intervention at 6 months after enrollment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ages 6-12 years
- Do not own a bicycle
- BMI over 85% for age (overweight or obese)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Outside of state age range
- Not overweight or obese
- Already own a bicycle.

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD will not be shared outside of the study.
